intro: Antidesma comorense, commonly known as the Comoros antidesma, is a shrub or small tree native to the Comoros Islands in the Indian Ocean. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its opposite, simple leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in clusters, followed by woody, three-angled fruits that contain several seeds. It is often found in coastal areas and dry forests, adapting well to the tropical climate of its native habitat.
